etymologies: late 15th century: from Old French repositoire or Latin repositorium, from reposit- ‘placed back’, from the verb reponere (see repose)

definitions: a place, building, or receptacle where things are or may be stored

examples.text: a deep repository for nuclear waste

shortDefinitions: place where or receptacle in which things are or may be stored

definitions: a place in which something, especially a natural resource, has accumulated or where it is found in significant quantities
shortDefinitions: place where something is found in significant quantities

definitions: a central location in which data is stored and managed

examples.text: the metadata will be aggregated in a repository

shortDefinitions: central location in which data is stored and managed

definitions: a person or thing regarded as a store of information or in which something abstract is held to exist or be found

examples.text: his mind was a rich repository of the past

shortDefinitions: person or thing regarded as store of information
